<Text: Sigma II-65 war game:  The games were designed to replicate then-current conditions in Indochina, with an aim toward predicting future foreign affairs events.>

Text: Sigma II-65 war game:  The games were supervised by a Control appointed to oversee both sides.

Text: Sigma II-65 war game:  The opposing Blue and Red Teams customary in war games were designated the friendly and enemy forces as was usual; however, several smaller teams were sometimes subsumed under Red and Blue Teams.

Text: Sigma II-65 war game:  Over the course of the games, the Red Team at times contained the Yellow Team for the Peoples Republic of China, the Brown Team for the Democratic Republic of Vietnam, the Black Team for the Viet Cong, and Green for the USSR.
